intro: Allium atroviolaceum var. firmotunicatum, commonly known as the dark violet garlic. This variant is characterized by its deep violet to almost black bulbils, which are typically larger and more robust than those of the standard species. The plant belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is native to specific regions in southern Africa. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers form a dense umbel with purple to violet petals. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique coloration.
